PainPoints.headline: Sound familiar?
PainPoints.subhead: France is home to 7.7 million immigrants â€” 11.3% of the population. Yet the admin system runs on 'Ã§a dÃ©pend' and endless paperwork.

0.title: You called the prÃ©fecture. 45 minutes on hold. Then they hung up.
0.description: When you finally get through, they speak too fast, use jargon you don't know, and can't tell you what YOU specifically need. Going in person? Even scarier.

1.title: Reddit says one thing. An expat group says another. Both are from 2021.
1.description: Expat forums are full of personal anecdotes that may or may not apply to your case. Fragmented, outdated, and impossible to verify. What worked in Lyon won't work in Paris 14e.

2.title: Your titre de sÃ©jour expires in 47 days. Nobody told you.
2.description: One missed deadline can cost you your right to stay. Visa renewals, CAF declarations, tax filings, CPAM registration â€” the system sends zero reminders. You're on your own.

0.q: Is AccueilAI a replacement for a lawyer?
0.a: No. AccueilAI is an information tool that helps you understand French administrative procedures using official government data. For complex legal situations, we always recommend consulting a qualified immigration lawyer.

1.q: How is this different from asking ChatGPT?
1.a: ChatGPT gives generic answers with no sources and can't keep up with France's constantly changing regulations. AccueilAI analyzes CESEDA law, service-public.gouv.fr, and official CAF/CPAM documentation in real time â€” every answer includes source links. We also accumulate real user experience data, so we reflect not just what the law says, but how things actually work in practice.

2.a: Visa & residency (VLS-TS, titre de sÃ©jour, APS, Talent Passport), housing (rental contracts, deposits, justificatif de domicile), financial aid (CAF â€” APL/ALS/ALF, RSA, Prime d'activitÃ©), healthcare (CPAM, Carte Vitale, Mutuelle), taxes (first declaration, numÃ©ro fiscal, double taxation), telecom & utilities, freelance & business (auto-entrepreneur, SIRET, URSSAF), banking, daily life (driver's license exchange, vehicle registration), and nationality acquisition.

3.a: Every answer includes the source link so you can verify. When the AI isn't confident, it tells you â€” and suggests consulting a professional. We never guess.

4.a: English, French, and Korean at launch. More languages coming based on demand.

5.a: We're in active development. Join the waitlist to get early access and lock in exclusive launch pricing.

Footer.tagline: AI-powered admin assistant for expats in France.
